title: Authors and Citation
text: Dubey Y (2025). “undpcomposite: UNDP Composite Indicators Timeseries.” doi:10.5281/zenodo.14845848, https://github.com/openwashdata/undpcomposite.
code: @Misc{dubey:2025,   title = {undpcomposite: UNDP Composite Indicators Timeseries},   author = {Yash Dubey},   year = {2025},   doi = {10.5281/zenodo.14845848},   url = {https://github.com/openwashdata/undpcomposite},   abstract = {Provides tidy data about all UNDP indicators in a composite timeseries.},   version = {0.1.0}, }

title: UNDP Composite Indicators Timeseries
text: goal undpcomposite provide tidy data UNDP composite data timeseries

title: UNDP Composite Indicators Timeseries
text: can install development version undpcomposite GitHub : Alternatively, can download individual datasets CSV XLSX file table . Click Download CSV. window opens displays CSV browser. Right-click anywhere inside window select “Save Page …”. Save file folder choice.
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("openwashdata/undpcomposite") ## Run the following code in console if you don't have the packages ## install.packages(c("dplyr", "knitr", "readr", "stringr", "gt", "kableExtra")) library(dplyr) library(knitr) library(readr) library(stringr) library(gt) library(kableExtra)

title: UNDP Composite Indicators Timeseries
text: dataset undpcomposite contains data UNDP indicators time. 6798 observations 45 variables overview variable names, see following table.

title: UNDP Composite Indicators Timeseries
text: Less developed countries exhibit higher adolescent birth rates developed countries
code: library(undpcomposite) library(ggplot2) library(dplyr)  # Ensure UTF-8 encoding for character columns undpcomposite <- undpcomposite |>   mutate(across(where(is.character), ~ iconv(.,"UTF-8","UTF-8",sub="")))  # Handle missing values in `abr` undpcomposite_clean <- undpcomposite |>    filter(country %in% c("United States", "Germany", "Niger", "Mali")) |>    mutate(     year = as.numeric(year),  # Convert year to numeric     abr = ifelse(is.na(abr), 0, abr)  # Replace NA values in abr   )  # Find min and max year year_range <- range(undpcomposite_clean$year, na.rm = TRUE)  # Create the plot with decade-based x-axis ggplot(undpcomposite_clean, aes(x = year, y = abr, color = country, group = country)) +   geom_line() +   scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(floor(year_range[1] / 10) * 10, ceiling(year_range[2] / 10) * 10, by = 10)) +     labs(     title = "Adolescent Birth Rate in Two High Income and Two Low Income Countries",     x = "Year",     y = "Adolescent Birth Rate (births per 1,000 women aged 15-29)"   ) +   theme_minimal()
